sections.heading: What is 〜っぽい?
sections.content:
〜っぽい (ppoi) expresses that something has characteristics of, seems like, or tends toward something. It can describe appearance, behavior, or tendency.

English equivalent: "seems like," "looks like," "-ish," "tends to"

Structure: [Noun / Verb ます-stem] + っぽい

子供 (kodomo - child) + っぽい = 子供っぽい "childish" 青 (ao - blue) + っぽい = 青っぽい "bluish" 怒る (okoru - get angry) → 怒り + っぽい = 怒りっぽい "quick to anger"

children.heading: With nouns
children.content:
[Noun] + っぽい

子供っぽい (kodomoppoi) - "childish" 大人っぽい (otonappoi) - "mature" / "adult-like" 男っぽい (otokoppoi) - "manly" 女っぽい (onnappoi) - "feminine"

children.heading: With verb stems
children.content:
[Verb ます-stem] + っぽい

怒りっぽい (okorippoi) - "quick to anger" 忘れっぽい (wasureppoi) - "forgetful" 飽きっぽい (akippoi) - "get bored easily" 疲れっぽい (tsukareppoi) - "tire easily"

children.heading: Looks like
children.content: 青っぽい色。 Aoppoi iro. "A bluish color." 緑っぽい服。 Midorippoi fuku. "Greenish clothes." 茶色っぽい髪。 Chairooppoi kami. "Brownish hair." 白っぽい壁。 Shiroppoi kabe. "Whitish walls."

children.heading: Behavioral characteristics
children.content: 子供っぽい人。 Kodomoppoi hito. "A childish person." 大人っぽい態度。 Otonappoi taido. "A mature attitude." 男っぽい性格。 Otokoppoi seikaku. "A manly personality." 女っぽい仕草。 Onnappoi shigusa. "Feminine gestures."

children.heading: Emotional tendencies
children.content: 怒りっぽい。 Okorippoi. "Quick to anger." 泣きっぽい。 Nakippoi. "Cry easily." 飽きっぽい性格。 Akippoi seikaku. "A personality that gets bored easily." 忘れっぽくなった。 Wasureppoku natta. "I've become forgetful."

children.heading: Approximate colors
children.content: 赤っぽい (akappoi) - "reddish" 青っぽい (aoppoi) - "bluish" 黄色っぽい (kiiroppoi) - "yellowish" 黒っぽい (kuroppoi) - "blackish" 白っぽい (shiroppoi) - "whitish" 茶色っぽい (chairooppoi) - "brownish" 灰色っぽい (haiirooppoi) - "grayish" 赤っぽいオレンジ。 Akappoi orenji. "A reddish orange." 黒っぽい服を着ている。 Kuroppoi fuku wo kite iru. "Wearing blackish clothes."

children.heading: Appearance and vibe
children.content: カジュアルっぽい服。 Kajuaruoppoi fuku. "Casual-looking clothes." フォーマルっぽい雰囲気。 Foomaruoppoi fun'iki. "A formal-ish atmosphere." スポーティーっぽいデザイン。 Supootii ppoi dezain. "A sporty-ish design."

children.heading: Physical properties
children.content: プラスチックっぽい。 Purasuchikkuppoi. "Plastic-like." 革っぽい素材。 Kawappoi sozai. "Leather-like material." 金属っぽい音。 Kinzokuoppoi oto. "A metallic sound." 紙っぽい質感。 Kamippoi shitsukan. "A paper-like texture."

children.heading: Age-related characteristics
children.content: 子供っぽい (kodomoppoi) - "childish" 大人っぽい (otonappoi) - "mature" / "grown-up" 彼女は大人っぽい。 Kanojo wa otonappoi. "She's mature for her age." 子供っぽい考え方。 Kodomoppoi kangaekata. "A childish way of thinking." 大人っぽい服装。 Otonappoi fukusou. "Mature-looking clothing."

children.heading: Masculine and feminine
children.content: 男っぽい (otokoppoi) - "manly" / "masculine" 女っぽい (onnappoi) - "feminine" / "womanly" 男っぽい話し方。 Otokoppoi hanashikata. "A manly way of speaking." 女っぽい仕草。 Onnappoi shigusa. "Feminine gestures."

children.heading: Functions like an adjective
children.content: 忘れっぽい人 (wasureppoi hito) - "a forgetful person" 子供っぽい行動 (kodomoppoi koudou) - "childish behavior" 彼は怒りっぽいです。 Kare wa okorippoi desu. "He's quick to anger." (polite) 青っぽい色でした。 Aoppoi iro deshita. "It was a bluish color."

children.heading: Negative and past forms
children.content:
Negative:

子供っぽくない (kodomoppoku nai) - "not childish" 全然子供っぽくない。 Zenzen kodomoppoku nai. "Not childish at all."

Past:

子供っぽかった (kodomoppokatta) - "was childish" 昔は子供っぽかった。 Mukashi wa kodomoppokatta. "I was childish in the past."

children.heading: With verbs
children.content: 忘れっぽい (wasureppoi) - "forgetful" 怒りっぽい (okorippoi) - "quick to anger" 飽きっぽい (akippoi) - "get bored easily" 泣きっぽい (nakippoi) - "cry easily" 疲れっぽい (tsukareppoi) - "tire easily" 照れっぽい (tereppoi) - "easily embarrassed"

children.heading: With nouns
children.content: 子供っぽい (kodomoppoi) - "childish" 大人っぽい (otonappoi) - "mature" 男っぽい (otokoppoi) - "manly" 女っぽい (onnappoi) - "feminine" 春っぽい (haruoppoi) - "spring-like" 秋っぽい (akippoi) - "autumn-like"

children.heading: Seasonal feel
children.content: 春っぽい天気。 Haruoppoi tenki. "Spring-like weather." 夏っぽい服。 Natsuoppoi fuku. "Summer-ish clothes." 秋っぽい色。 Akippoi iro. "Autumn-like colors." 冬っぽい寒さ。 Fuyuoppoi samusa. "Winter-like cold."

sections.heading: Polite Forms
sections.content: Casual: 子供っぽい Polite: 子供っぽいです Negative: 子供っぽくない / 子供っぽくないです Past: 子供っぽかった / 子供っぽかったです 彼女は大人っぽいです。 Kanojo wa otonappoi desu. "She's mature." 赤っぽい色でした。 Akappoi iro deshita. "It was a reddish color."

children.heading: Similar expressions
children.content:
っぽい - Seems like/tends to:

子供っぽい (kodomoppoi) "childish" 青っぽい (aoppoi) "bluish"

らしい - Typical of:

子供らしい (kodomoらしい) "child-like" (appropriate for a child)

みたい - Looks like:

子供みたい (kodomo mitai) "like a child"

| Pattern | Nuance | Example | | ------- | --------------------- | ---------- | | っぽい | Has tendency/似ている | 子供っぽい | | らしい | Typical/appropriate | 子供らしい | | みたい | Looks like/seems | 子供みたい |

children.heading: Informal usage
children.content:
っぽい is quite casual and common in everyday conversation.

それ、ちょっと子供っぽいよ。 Sore, chotto kodomoppoi yo. "That's a bit childish." 青っぽい色がいい。 Aoppoi iro ga ii. "I like bluish colors." 最近忘れっぽくなった。 Saikin wasureppoku natta. "I've become forgetful lately."

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using wrong form
children.content:
❌ 子供いっぽい ✓ 子供っぽい

Use っぽい, not いっぽい.

children.heading: Mistake 2: Confusing with らしい
children.content: 子供っぽい = childish (often negative) 子供らしい = child-like (positive, appropriate)

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong verb form
children.content:
❌ 怒るっぽい ✓ 怒りっぽい

Use ます-stem with verbs.

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using with adjectives directly
children.content:
❌ 高いっぽい (unnatural) ✓ 高そう (seems expensive)

っぽい doesn't attach directly to い-adjectives.

sections.heading: Summary
sections.content:
Key Points:

っぽい expresses similarity, tendency, or characteristic Formation: [Noun / Verb ます-stem] + っぽい Means "seems like," "-ish," or "tends to" Functions as い-adjective Common with: colors (青っぽい), age (子供っぽい), emotions (怒りっぽい) Quite casual in tone Different from らしい (typical) and みたい (looks like) Essential for describing characteristics and tendencies

examples.sentence: っぽい expresses similarity, tendency, or characteristic
Formation: [Noun / Verb ます-stem] + っぽい
Common with: colors (青っぽい), age (子供っぽい), emotions (怒りっぽい)
Different from らしい (typical) and みたい (looks like)
Essential for describing characteristics and tendencies
